definition: The governing body of a nation, state, or community.
Existing, occurring, or carried on between nations.
The aggregate of people living together in a more or less ordered community.
All existing matter and space considered as a whole.
The system of production, consumption, and distribution of goods and services.
The study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.
The ability of the mind to be creative or resourceful.
A forcible overthrow of a government or social order in favor of a new system.
The systematic investigation into and study of materials and sources to establish facts.
The transmission of customs or beliefs from generation to generation.
